articles.title: ChatGPT: Everything you need to know about the AI-powered chatbot
articles.content: ChatGPT, OpenAI’s text-generating AI chatbot, has taken the world by storm since its launch in November 2022. What started as a tool to hyper-charge productivity through writing essays and code with short text prompts has evolved into a behemoth used by more than 92% of Fortune 500 companies. That growth has propelled OpenAI itself into becoming one of the most-hyped companies in recent memory. And its latest partnership with Apple for its upcoming generative AI offering, Apple Intelligence, has

articles.title: Recession risk as Britain reels from Reeves’s Budget
articles.content: Economists have sounded the alarm over a UK recession after data showed Britain’s economy was reeling from the effects of Rachel Reeves’s tax-raising Budget.

articles.title: Apple to develop a more conversational Siri
articles.content: Tech giant Apple (AAPL) is developing a more sophisticated version of Siri, designed to become a more conversational digital assistant. The enhanced version of Siri will be capable of handling complex requests, positioning Apple to compete with advanced AI tools like ChatGPT. Catalysts Co-hosts Seana Smith and Madison Mills break down the details. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Catalysts here. This post was written by Angel Smith

articles.title: Apple and Google face UK investigation into mobile browser dominance
articles.content: Apple and Google aren't giving consumers a genuine choice of mobile web browsers, a British watchdog said Friday in a report that recommends they face an investigation under new U.K. digital rules taking effect next year.  The Competition and Markets Authority took aim at Apple, saying the iPhone maker's tactics hold back innovation by stopping rivals from giving users new features like faster webpage loading.  Apple does this by restricting progressive web apps, which don't need to be downloaded from an app store and aren't subject to app store commissions, the report said.

articles.title: Apple’s iPhones Sales Aren’t Getting an AI Boost. How and When That Could Change.
articles.content: Apple  much-heralded rollout of artificial-intelligence capabilities for the iPhone looks to still be underwhelming buyers.  Apple Intelligence—the company’s brand of AI—was officially released to the U.S. public on the most recent iPhone models late last month.  “Even as consumers familiarize themselves with Apple Intelligence…the data indicates that demand has been relatively muted thus far,”  analyst David Vogt wrote in a research note.
